translation: What is that? - That is an apple.
What are you doing today? - I am going to the cinema.
What is your profession? - I am a teacher by profession.
What would you like to drink? - I would like a coffee.
What does that cost? - That costs ten euros.

fullQuestionExample: Was ist die Hauptstadt von Deutschland?
translation: What is the capital of Germany? - The capital is Berlin.
What is for dinner? - There is soup and bread.
What is your phone number? - My phone number is 12345.
Who is that? - That is my sister Anna.

answer: Ein berühmter Autor hat es geschrieben.
translation: Who wrote the book? - A famous author wrote it.

answer_es: Muchos amigos vienen a la fiesta.
translation: Who is coming to the party? - Many friends are coming to the party.
Who can help me? - I can help you.

answer_es: El presidente es el Sr. Müller.
translation: Who is the president? - The president is Mr. Müller.
Who sings this song? - A well-known singer sings it.
Who called? - Your brother called.
Who lives here? - The Schmidt family lives here.

answer: Dein Handy ist auf dem Tisch.
answer_es: Tu móvil está sobre la mesa.
translation: Where is my phone? - Your phone is on the table.
Where do you work? - I work in an office.

answer: Der Supermarkt ist um die Ecke.
answer_es: El supermercado está a la vuelta de la esquina.
translation: Where is the nearest supermarket? - The supermarket is around the corner.
Where can I park? - You can park here.
Where were you yesterday? - I was at home.

answer: Wir treffen uns vor dem Kino.
translation: Where do we meet? - We meet in front of the cinema.
Where is Austria located? - Austria is in Europe.

answer: Das Restaurant ist neben der Bank.
answer_es: El restaurante está al lado del banco.
translation: Where is the restaurant? - The restaurant is next to the bank.
When are you coming? - I am coming at five o'clock.
When is the meeting? - The meeting is tomorrow.

fullQuestionExample: Wann fliegst du in den Urlaub?
translation: When are you flying on vacation? - I am flying next week.

answer: Er hat vor einer Stunde angerufen.
translation: When did he call? - He called an hour ago.
When does the shop open? - The shop opens at 9 o'clock.

answer: Wir können uns am Samstag sehen.
translation: When can we see each other? - We can see each other on Saturday.

fullQuestionExample: Wann ist das Konzert zu Ende?
answer: Das Konzert ist um elf zu Ende.
answer_es: El concierto termina a las once.
translation: When does the concert end? - The concert ends at eleven.
When does the movie start? - The movie starts soon.
How are you today? - I am fine, thank you.
How old are you (formal)? - I am thirty years old.
How is the weather? - The weather is nice.

questionStem_es: ¿___ llego a la oficina de correos?
answer_es: Tiene que girar a la izquierda.
translation: How do I get to the post office? - You have to turn left.

answer_es: Mi fin de semana fue muy agradable.
translation: How was your weekend? - My weekend was very nice.
How do you write that? - You write it with 'S'.
What time is it? (How late is it?) - It is four o'clock.
How do you find the movie? - I find the movie boring.
Where do you come from, Mrs. Meier? - I come from Germany.

answer: Ich habe sie aus dem Internet.
translation: Where did you get this information from? - I got it from the internet.

answer: Ich kenne ihn von der Arbeit.
translation: Where do you know him from? - I know him from work.
Where is the wind coming from today? - The wind is coming from the west.

answer: Diese Blumen sind aus dem Garten.
translation: Where are these flowers from? - These flowers are from the garden.
Where do you get the time from? - I plan my day well.

answer: Das Rezept stammt von meiner Oma.
answer_es: La receta proviene de mi abuela.
translation: Where does this recipe come from? - The recipe comes from my grandma.

answer: Ich habe es in der Schule gelernt.
translation: Where did you learn that from? - I learned it in school.

answer: Ein Kilo Äpfel kostet drei Euro.
answer_es: Un kilo de manzanas cuesta tres euros.
translation: How much does a kilo of apples cost? - A kilo of apples costs three euros.
How much time do we need? - We need about an hour.
How many children do you have? - I have no children.

fullQuestionExample: Wieviel kostet die Miete pro Monat?
translation: How much is the rent per month? - The rent is 500 euros.
How many degrees is it today? - It is 25 degrees today.
How much luggage can I take? - You can take 20 kilos.
How many languages do you speak? - I speak three languages.

questionStem_es: ¿___ cuesta una taza de café aquí?
fullQuestionExample: Wieviel kostet eine Tasse Kaffee hier?
answer_es: Una taza de café cuesta 2,50 euros.
translation: How much does a cup of coffee cost here? - A cup of coffee costs 2.50 euros.
Why is the sky blue? - The light is scattered.
Why are you late? - My bus was delayed.
Why do you like this movie? - The movie is very exciting.
Why doesn't that work? - It might be broken.
Why did you do that? - I wanted to help you.

answer: Sport ist gut für die Gesundheit.
answer_es: El deporte es bueno para la salud.
translation: Why is sport important? - Sport is good for health.
Why are bananas crooked? - They grow towards the sun.
Why are you crying? - I am a bit sad.

fullQuestionExample: Wohin gehst du nach der Schule?
translation: Where are you going after school? - I am going straight home.

fullQuestionExample: Wohin fahren Sie in den Ferien?
translation: Where are you going for the holidays? - We are going to the Baltic Sea.

fullQuestionExample: Wohin soll ich das Paket bringen?
answer: Bitte bringen Sie es zur Post.
answer_es: Por favor, llévelo a la oficina de correos.
translation: Where should I take this package? - Please take it to the post office.
Where does this path lead? - This path leads to the lake.

fullQuestionExample: Wohin möchtest du am liebsten reisen?
translation: Where would you most like to travel? - I would like to travel to Japan.

answer: Ich stelle sie auf den Tisch.
translation: Where are you putting the flowers? - I am putting them on the table.

answer: Alle sind in den Park gegangen.
translation: Where did everyone go? - Everyone went to the park.
Where are you flying in winter? - We are flying to the mountains.
Which color is your bike? - My bike is blue.

answer: Der Bus Nummer fünf fährt dorthin.
answer_es: El autobús número cinco va allí.
translation: Which bus goes to the center? - Bus number five goes there.
Which book are you reading right now? - I am reading a crime novel.
Which music do you like to listen to? - I like to listen to pop music.

fullQuestionExample: Welchen Film schauen wir heute Abend?
translation: Which movie are we watching tonight? - We are watching a comedy.

questionStem_es: ¿___ día de la semana es tu favorito?
answer_es: Mi día favorito es el sábado.
translation: Which day of the week is your favorite day? - My favorite day is Saturday.
Which restaurant do you recommend? - I recommend the Italian restaurant.
Which pants fit better? - The blue pants fit better.
In which district do you live? (formal) - I live in Schwabing.

fullQuestionExample: Wie viele Etagen hat das Haus?
translation: How many floors does the house have? - The house has three floors.

questionStem_es: ¿Cómo de grande es su sala de estar?
answer: Mein Wohnzimmer ist nicht zu groß.
answer_es: Mi sala de estar no es demasiado grande.
translation: How big is your living room? (formal) - My living room is not too big.

answer: Meine Wohnung ist klein aber gemütlich.
answer_es: Mi apartamento es pequeño pero acogedor.
translation: How is your apartment? - My apartment is small but cozy.

answer: Mein Haus ist groß und hat einen Garten.
answer_es: Mi casa es grande y tiene un jardín.
translation: How is your house? - My house is big and has a garden.
What do they speak in Mexico? - They speak Spanish in Mexico.

questionStem: ___ von Kaffee trinkst du am liebsten?
questionStem_es: ¿___ tipo de café te gusta más tomar?
fullQuestionExample: Welche Art von Kaffee trinkst du am liebsten?
answer: Ich trinke am liebsten schwarzen Kaffee.
translation: What kind of coffee do you like to drink the most? - I like to drink black coffee the most.

fullQuestionExample: Wieviel kostet ein Kaffee in Mexiko?
translation: How much does a coffee cost in Mexico? - A coffee costs about 30 pesos.

fullQuestionExample: Wieviel kostet ein Kaffee in Deutschland?
translation: How much does a coffee cost in Germany? - A coffee costs about 3 euros.

fullQuestionExample: Wieviel Wasser trinkst du pro Tag?
answer: Ich trinke zwei Liter Wasser pro Tag.
answer_es: Bebo dos litros de agua al día.
translation: How much water do you drink per day? - I drink two liters of water per day.

fullQuestionExample: Wieviel Kaffee trinkst du pro Tag?
answer: Ich trinke drei Tassen Kaffee pro Tag.
answer_es: Bebo tres tazas de café al día.
translation: How much coffee do you drink per day? - I drink three cups of coffee per day.
How do you like the fish? - I like it.
How do you like the strawberries? - I like them very much.

questionStem_es: ¿___ te parecen tus zapatillas de deporte?
translation: How do you like your sports shoes? - They are very comfortable.

questionStem: ___ gefällt dir der Kaffee von Starbucks?
questionStem_es: ¿___ te parece el café de Starbucks?
fullQuestionExample: Wie gefällt dir der Kaffee von Starbucks?
translation: How do you like the coffee from Starbucks? - It's tasty, but expensive.

fullQuestionExample: Wie gefällt dir die deutsche Sprache?
translation: How do you like the German language? - It's interesting, but difficult.
How do you like the beer? - I like German beer.
How do you like the cinema? - The cinema here is modern.

questionStem: ___ gefallen dir die Filme auf Netflix?
questionStem_es: ¿___ te parecen las películas en Netflix?
fullQuestionExample: Wie gefallen dir die Filme auf Netflix?
translation: How do you like the movies on Netflix? - Some movies are good.
How do you like the chocolate? - The chocolate is very tasty.
How do you like your bedroom? - My bedroom is cozy.

questionStem: ___ gefallen dir die Strände von Mexiko?
questionStem_es: ¿___ te parecen las playas de México?
fullQuestionExample: Wie gefallen dir die Strände von Mexiko?
translation: How do you like the beaches of Mexico? - The beaches are wonderful.
How do you like the fish? (formal) - It tastes excellent.
How do you like the mountains? (formal) - The mountains are impressive.

questionStem_es: ¿___ le parecen sus zapatillas de deporte?
translation: How do you like your sports shoes? (formal) - They fit very well.
How do you like the rain? (formal) - The rain is refreshing.

answer_es: Los lunes estoy a menudo cansado/a.
translation: How do you like Mondays? (formal) - I am often tired on Mondays.
How do you like the beer? (formal) - The beer here tastes good.
How do you like Mexico? (formal) - Mexico is a beautiful country.

questionStem: ___ gefallen Ihnen die Filme auf Netflix?
questionStem_es: ¿___ le parecen las películas en Netflix?
fullQuestionExample: Wie gefallen Ihnen die Filme auf Netflix?
translation: How do you like the movies on Netflix? (formal) - The selection is very large.

answer: Diese Schokolade ist von hoher Qualität.
answer_es: Este chocolate es de alta calidad.
translation: How do you like the chocolate? (formal) - This chocolate is of high quality.
How do you like my bedroom? (formal) - Your bedroom is very bright.

questionStem: ___ gefallen Ihnen die Strände von Deutschland?
questionStem_es: ¿___ le parecen las playas de Alemania?
fullQuestionExample: Wie gefallen Ihnen die Strände von Deutschland?
answer: Die Strände an der Ostsee sind schön.
answer_es: Las playas del Mar Báltico son hermosas.
translation: How do you like the beaches of Germany? (formal) - The beaches on the Baltic Sea are beautiful.
How do you like the apartment? - The apartment is very central.

answer: Das Haus hat einen tollen Garten.
answer_es: La casa tiene un jardín estupendo.
translation: How do you like the house? - The house has a great garden.
